00001 /**
00002  * @file epapi_term.cc
00003  *
00004  * @date   2009-09-28
00005  * @author jldupont
00006  *
00007  *
00008  * ERL_SMALL_INTEGER_EXT : 8  bits integer
00009  * ERL_INTEGER_EXT:        32 bits integer
00010  *
00011  * ERL_SMALL_BIG_EXT:      8  bits arity, bignum  -- might fit in 32/64 bits
00012  * ERL_LARGE_BIG_EXT:      32 bits arity, bignum  -- might fit in 32/64 bits
00013  *
00014  */
00015 #include "epapi.h"
00016 
00017 using namespace std;

00019 const char *
00020 TermHandler::term_strings[] = {
00021         "TERMTYPE_INVALID"
00022         ,"TERMTYPE_END"
00023         ,"TERMTYPE_START_LIST"
00024         ,"TERMTYPE_END_LIST"
00025         ,"TERMTYPE_START_TUPLE"
00026         ,"TERMTYPE_ATOM"
00027         ,"TERMTYPE_STRING"
00028         ,"TERMTYPE_DOUBLE"
00029         ,"TERMTYPE_LONG"
00030         ,"TERMTYPE_ULONG"
00031         ,"TERMTYPE_LONGLONG"
00032         ,"TERMTYPE_ULONGLONG"
00033         ,"TERMTYPE_BINARY"
00034         ,"TERMTYPE_NIL"
00035 };
00036 
00037 const char *
00038 TermHandler::termtype_tostring(TermType type) {
00039 
00040         if (type>((int)(sizeof(term_strings)/sizeof(int))))
00041                 return NULL;
00042 
00043         return term_strings[type];
00044 }

00046 
00047 TermHandler::TermHandler(void) {
00048         p=NULL;
00049         index=0;
00050 }
00051 
00052 // Cleaning up packet 'p' is
00053 // not our responsibility... we were just
00054 // loaned those!
00055 TermHandler::~TermHandler() {
00056 }
00057 
00058 void
00059 TermHandler::init(Pkt *_p) {
00060 
00061         p=_p;
00062         index=0;
00063 }
00064 
00065 void
00066 TermHandler::clean(TermStruct *ts) {
00067         if (NULL==ts) return;
00068 
00069         switch(ts->type) {
00070         case TERMTYPE_ATOM:
00071         case TERMTYPE_STRING:
00072         case TERMTYPE_BINARY:
00073 
00074                 if (NULL!=ts->Value.string) {
00075                         free(ts->Value.string);
00076                         // prevent double-free
00077                         ts->Value.string = NULL;
00078                 }
00079                 break;
00080         default:
00081                 break;
00082         }
00083 
00084 }
00085 
00086 int
00087 TermHandler::append(TermStruct *ts) {
00088 
00089         if (NULL==ts) {
00090                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append - need a valid TermStruct!");
00091                 last_error=EEPAPI_NULL;
00092                 return 1;
00093         }
00094 
00095         if (NULL==p) {
00096                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append - need a packet!");
00097                 last_error = EEPAPI_NULL;
00098                 return 1;
00099         }
00100 
00101          //local shortcut
00102         ei_x_buff *b = p->getTxBuf();
00103         if (NULL==b) {
00104                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append - need a TX packet!");
00105                 last_error = EEPAPI_MALLOC;
00106                 return 1;
00107         }
00108 
00109         //DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: type: %i", ts->type);
00110         int result;
00111 
00112         switch(ts->type) {
00113 
00114         // for convenience
00115         case TERMTYPE_END:
00116                 result=0; //pass-through
00117                 break;
00118 
00119         case TERMTYPE_START_LIST:
00120                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: LIST_HEADER, size: %i", ts->size);
00121                 result=ei_x_encode_list_header(b, ts->size);
00122                 break;
00123 
00124         case TERMTYPE_NIL:
00125         case TERMTYPE_END_LIST:
00126                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: NIL");
00127                 result=ei_x_encode_empty_list(b);
00128                 break;
00129 
00130         case TERMTYPE_ATOM:
00131                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: ATOM: %s", ts->Value.string);
00132                 result=ei_x_encode_atom(b, (const char *)ts->Value.string);
00133                 break;
00134 
00135         case TERMTYPE_START_TUPLE:
00136                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: TUPLE, size: %i", ts->size);
00137                 result=ei_x_encode_tuple_header(b, (int) ts->size);
00138                 break;
00139 
00140         case TERMTYPE_DOUBLE:
00141                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: DOUBLE, value: %f", ts->Value.afloat);
00142                 result=ei_x_encode_double(b, ts->Value.afloat);
00143                 break;
00144 
00145         case TERMTYPE_LONG:
00146                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: LONG, value: %l", ts->Value.integer);
00147                 result=ei_x_encode_long(b, ts->Value.integer);
00148                 break;
00149 
00150         case TERMTYPE_ULONG:
00151                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: ULONG, value: %ul", ts->Value.uinteger);
00152                 result=ei_x_encode_ulong(b, ts->Value.uinteger);
00153                 break;
00154 
00155         case TERMTYPE_LONGLONG:
00156                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: LONGLONG");
00157                 result=ei_x_encode_longlong(b, ts->Value.linteger);
00158                 break;
00159 
00160         case TERMTYPE_ULONGLONG:
00161                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: ULONGLONG");
00162                 result=ei_x_encode_ulonglong(b, ts->Value.luinteger);
00163                 break;
00164 
00165         case TERMTYPE_STRING:
00166                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: STRING: %s", ts->Value.string);
00167                 result=ei_x_encode_string(b, (const char *) ts->Value.string);
00168                 break;
00169 
00170         case TERMTYPE_BINARY:
00171                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: BINARY");
00172                 result=ei_x_encode_binary(b, ts->Value.string, ts->size);
00173                 break;
00174 
00175         default:
00176                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::append: ERROR");
00177                 result=1;
00178                 break;
00179 
00180         }//switch
00181 
00182         return result;
00183 }

00185 
00186 /**
00187  * Iterates through the received packet and
00188  * extracts the elements of the term() 1by1
00189  *
00190  * The function returns the Term of type 'TERMTYPE_END'
00191  * when the end of the received term() is reached.
00192  *
00193  * It is the responsibility of the caller to dispose of
00194  * the returned Term through the TermPointer variable.
00195  */
00196 int
00197 TermHandler::iter(TermStruct *ptr) {
00198 
00199         if ((NULL==p) || (NULL==ptr)){
00200                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter - need a valid TermStruct / Pkt!");
00201                 last_error=EEPAPI_NULL;
00202                 return 1;
00203         }
00204 
00205         unsigned char *buf;
00206 
00207         buf=p->getBuf();
00208         if (NULL==buf) {
00209                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter - need a valid RX Pkt!");
00210                 last_error=EEPAPI_NULL;
00211                 return 1;
00212         }
00213 
00214         int result;
00215         int version;
00216 
00217         // we are just starting... read the version header first
00218         if (0==index) {
00219                 result=ei_decode_version((const char *)buf, &index, &version);
00220                 if (result) {
00221                         last_error=EEPAPI_EIDECODE;
00222                         return 1;
00223                 }
00224                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: Version: %i", version);
00225         }//if
00226 
00227 
00228 
00229         //we are at least past the 'version' field of the packet from hereon
00230         //we need to figure out which 'type' follows
00231         int type;
00232         int size;
00233         result=ei_get_type((const char *)buf, &index, &type, &size);
00234         if (result) {
00235                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: get_type ERROR");
00236                 last_error=EEPAPI_EIDECODE;
00237                 return 1;
00238         }
00239 
00240         //DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: type: %i", type);
00241 
00242         char *sptr;
00243 
00244         switch(type) {
00245         case ERL_SMALL_INTEGER_EXT:
00246         case ERL_INTEGER_EXT:
00247                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: SMALL_INTEGER/INTEGER");
00248                 result=ei_decode_long((const char *)buf, &index, &(ptr->Value.integer));
00249                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_LONG;
00250 
00251                 if (result) {
00252                         result=ei_decode_ulong((const char *)buf, &index, &(ptr->Value.uinteger));
00253                         ptr->type=TERMTYPE_ULONG;
00254                 }
00255                 break;
00256         case ERL_LARGE_BIG_EXT:
00257         case ERL_SMALL_BIG_EXT:
00258                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: BIG_EXT");
00259                 result=ei_decode_longlong((const char *)buf, &index, &(ptr->Value.linteger));
00260                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_LONGLONG;
00261 
00262                 if (result) {
00263                         result=ei_decode_ulonglong((const char *)buf, &index, &(ptr->Value.luinteger));
00264                         ptr->type=TERMTYPE_ULONGLONG;
00265                 }
00266                 break;
00267 
00268         case ERL_ATOM_EXT:
00269                 sptr=(char*) malloc(sizeof(char)*size+sizeof(char));
00270                 if (NULL==sptr) {
00271                         last_error=EEPAPI_MALLOC;
00272                         return 1;
00273                 }
00274                 result=ei_decode_atom((const char *)buf, &index, sptr);
00275                 ptr->Value.string=sptr;
00276                 ptr->size=size;
00277                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_ATOM;
00278                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: ATOM, size: %i", size);
00279                 break;
00280 
00281         case ERL_FLOAT_EXT:
00282                 result=ei_decode_double((const char *)buf, &index, &(ptr->Value.afloat));
00283                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_DOUBLE;
00284                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: FLOAT, value: %f", ptr->Value.afloat);
00285                 break;
00286 
00287         case ERL_SMALL_TUPLE_EXT:
00288         case ERL_LARGE_TUPLE_EXT:
00289                 result=ei_decode_tuple_header((const char *)buf, &index, &size);
00290                 ptr->size= (long) size;
00291                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_START_TUPLE;
00292                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: TUPLE, size: %i", size);
00293                 break;
00294 
00295         case ERL_STRING_EXT:
00296                 sptr=(char*) malloc(sizeof(char)*size+sizeof(char));
00297                 if (NULL==sptr) {
00298                         last_error=EEPAPI_MALLOC;
00299                         return 1;
00300                 }
00301                 result=ei_decode_string((const char *)buf, &index, sptr);
00302                 ptr->Value.string=sptr;
00303                 ptr->size=size;
00304                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_STRING;
00305                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: STRING, size: %i", size);
00306                 break;
00307 
00308         case ERL_LIST_EXT:
00309                 result=ei_decode_list_header((const char *)buf, &index, &size);
00310                 ptr->size=(long) size;
00311                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_START_LIST;
00312                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: LIST, size: %i", size);
00313                 break;
00314 
00315         case ERL_BINARY_EXT:
00316                 sptr=(char*) malloc(sizeof(char)*size+sizeof(char));
00317                 if (NULL==sptr) {
00318                         last_error=EEPAPI_MALLOC;
00319                         return 1;
00320                 }
00321                 result=ei_decode_binary((const char *)buf, &index, sptr, &(ptr->size));
00322                 ptr->Value.string=sptr;
00323                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_BINARY;
00324                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: BINARY, size: %l", size);
00325                 break;
00326 
00327                 // Received often as termination
00328                 // but I cannot be 100% sure.
00329                 // With proper buffer initialization,
00330                 // NULL will be caught instead.
00331         case ERL_NIL_EXT:
00332                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: NIL");
00333                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_NIL;
00334                 result=0;
00335                 break;
00336 
00337 
00338         // If the receive memory was properly zero'ed
00339         // (e.g. using the "clean" method on the Pkt instance)
00340         case 0:
00341                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: NULL");
00342                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_END;
00343                 result=0;
00344                 break;
00345 
00346         // Unsupported types
00347         // ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
00348         case ERL_REFERENCE_EXT:
00349         case ERL_NEW_REFERENCE_EXT:
00350         case ERL_PORT_EXT:
00351         case ERL_PID_EXT:
00352         case ERL_NEW_FUN_EXT:
00353         case ERL_FUN_EXT:
00354         default:
00355                 ptr->type=TERMTYPE_UNSUPPORTED;
00356                 DBGLOG(LOG_ERR, "TermHandler::iter: UNSUPPORTED (type: %i)", ptr->type);
00357                 result=1;
00358                 last_error=EEPAPI_BADTYPE;
00359                 break;
00360         }//switch
00361 
00362         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "TermHandler::iter: Result: %i", result);
00363 
00364         return result;
00365 }//
